title: The new arcade skins are cool but Xerath hasn't had a skin since 2015

replies.body:
I just realized Kai'sa will now have more skins than Xerath. That's 5 skins in ~15 months for Kai vs 0 skins in over 4 years for Xer.

Bullet Angel, K/DA, Prestige K/DA, IG, Arcade (5 or 4.5 if you don't count Prestige as a full skin)
vs
Battlecast, Runeborn, Scorched Earth, GotS (4)

In Riot's defense, E-Sports skins aren't their call, they are a reward for the players, and JackeyLove picked Kai'Sa. That said, it IS a little strange how Riot is releasing so many skins for her. Feels like K/DA just came out.

No one plays Ornn so Riot has no one to milk for money. Unpopular champs don't tend to get a lot of skins. 

I'm saying this as someone that enjoys playing Ornn.
Better give Kai'Sa her fifth skin in a year

2 legendaries back to back (ez and jhin) and 2 MORE adcs are getting skins (kaisa/caitlyn) plus tristana. Like hot damn xD what happened to other champs? Other classes? 

I was hoping Xerath gets another skin, lol was planning on picking him up jeez. I bet more adcs will get skins next cycle.

I'm almost positive we'll see a few more ADC skins in the other popular themes like Project and Star Guardian this year as well.   Bet things like Ashe, Sivir (even though she already had Bloodmoon), Xayah, Jinx will sneak their way into those themes.  I'd say Fortune too but she has GG which would have a similar idea to Project... so eh maybe not her.

Imagine being correct about how ADCs are the only ones that are getting skins
But seriously hot damn, within this post, Ashe got High Noon, 
Xayah got Star Guardian,
Jinx gets Project,
I'm starting to notice a pattern here...
I was genuinely expecting Battle Boss Xerath. I have no idea what to expect anymore.
Nothing really. In universe where Yasuo is better fit for Battle Boss than Xerath, Vel'Koz or any other monster champ they might as well openly say fuck you tot hose palyers who play them.

Yasuo isn't really an ill fit, but I agree that Xerath is a better fit. Feels like the Battle Boss skin line was made for him, the only Champ I'd say fits better is Veigar, who was obviously well taken care of.

Udyr, Skarner, Xerath, Zilean

{{sticker:zombie-nunu-bummed}}

At least with Dark Star, they gave them to champs that don't get a huge amount of skins; Karma doesn't have a lot of *really* good skins and Shaco, as much I as I hate the champion and think he's toxic, hasn't had a skin in years. Even Jhin doesn't have a ton though he's definitely more popular. 

I'm not sure how I feel about their choices for the Arcade this year though. Especially since I think Kai'sa's isn't very good. :/ Something about her anatomy is off in the splash art and I feel like the way she's positioned isn't very good.

> At least with Dark Star, they gave them to champs that don't get a huge amount of skins; Karma doesn't have a lot of *really* good skins and Shaco, as much I as I hate the champion and think he's toxic, hasn't had a skin in years. Even Jhin doesn't have a ton though he's definitely more popular. 


when you look at skins compared to a champion's age jhin stands on top. But hey the boards like jhin so it's ok.
Yeah, I was seeing comments that "Kai'Sa is the new Lux", but wouldn't it be "the new Jhin" more than anyone else?

Champions that get 1 or more skin yearly = Lux/Ezreal tier.
Champions that get 1 or more skins every other year = Jhin tier.

Though I still think its too early to put Kai'Sa into any tier, considering that she's still just a year old, while Jhin is 3. She could get more skins in the coming years, or none at all.

Yasuo is Lux/Ezreal tier at this point though, since he got Nightbringer, Odyssey, and Battle Boss all in a row.
Jhin is not "every other year"; he's gotten 4 in 3 years, not counting release.  Even if you don't count SKT T1 because it's "not part of the regular skin schedule", that's still 1 a year.
Jhin is every other year. He got 3 skins in 2017(Blood Moon, SKT, and PROJECT), none in 2018, and Dark Cosmic in 2019.
By that logic, Lux isn't yearly either, since she got skins in 2011, 2013, 2015, 2016, and 2018 and now 2019.

yeah the prestige(forgot about this one) and team skins really bumped her up, doesn't change the fact that both are doing the same thing. yet kai'sa gets shit for it and noone here ever seems to be bothered when jhin gets another one.

Meanwhile Kai'sa,
"In case y’all forgot: Kai’Sa was released in March 2018 and now, just shy of a year, will have 4 epic skins and 1 mythic skin. That’s five skins. In a year."
- Some random guy in the Arcade Kai'Sa comments

The reaction to this decision by Riot is so laughably predictable that there's only 2 options here:

1. Riot is incompetent
2. Riot simply doesn't care and is more interested in quick cash grabs

Take your pick

From a business perspective I can see why they focus on popular champions (i.e. Ezreal, Lux, Kai'sa), but Xerath still has a half-decent pick rate so I still don't get why it's been so incredibly long

I don't know why they did ALL hyper popular Champion skins for this theme. Like with Dark Star, they had Jhin (who is very popular, a money maker if you will) and then they had Shaco (who hasn't had a skin in years) and Karma (who has had some good skins in the past, but doesn't have a ton). That seems more balanced, like yeah, obviously some of the skins are going to be for the more popular Champions, but as long as some are going to the more niche or even Champs of middling popularity like Xerath, Karma, Ornn, Rek'Sai, etc, then its fine. I just find it unusual, mostly.
truer words were never spoken

I've been expecting Arcade Ekko since his release. His particles look like they could be made for that skin. But hey better give Kaisa another skin and dump the other arcade skin on a champion with barely any particles to even show off.
It’s Riot Skin Team, not justice nor common sense that decides who gets a skin and which.
BUT Kai'sa didn't get a skin in 2 minutes. Please get in line.

Honestly I'm kinda disappointed about the battleboss skins.

I mean what kind of boss do Qiyana and yasuo represent?
Sure there are some Samurai bosses, but Samurais can be just as often player characters and Qiyana looks like she just got the boss skin because she gets released in the same patch and happens to be a more antagonistic character.

Yasuo kind of reminds me of Meta Knight or something similar, or more specifically those reflex mini-games in the Kirby series, where Meta Knight is the hardest guy to beat. Qiyana is like one of those snooty female bosses, I feel like her personality fits with a campy female Arcade villain. But I agree they aren't the BEST fit, they just fit ok.

Honestly I wish they had pulled a dragon master swain on this skin release and given us Battle Boss Mordekaiser given that the "tin tyrant" is one of the most common boss characters in fantasy video games.

Honestly, Boss Xerath and Glitched/Bugged Boss Mordekaiser seemed like a given, one due to demand and the other due to the recently baked rework and the inmense amount of memes about Morde's bugs, but neither got made...
Oooo I never thought of that one. Glitch Boss. Now that could be a fun theme to have.  He like flickers in and out.
well, he's not a female humanoid so nope.  no skin for him.
Taliyah and Kalista are. Sorry, forgot, not allowed to be good because of pro so not popular.
I feel Taliyah is less popular because she's unusually mechanically inclined for a mage, not strictly because she's not strong without co-ordination.
The {{champion:157}} skin does not even fit well. It kinda just looks like they slapped some arcade particles on him and said, "ok this works."
People, we need to stop focusing on complaining about gameplay and start complaining about the skins they're making.

I stated this in another thread, but I'll say it here too.

They are probably alternating between forgotten champions and popular champions so that they don't lose too much money. For example, Shaco was in the "1000 days" club, and he just got a new skin. So, now, its time for a full cast of "popular champions". Next release, they'll probably give another "forgotten" champion a skin.

Don't give up hope yet. There's still time.
Kinda let down tbh
Kalista only has Championship and a team skin. Taliyah also only has a team skin. Seems like once they get team skins, Riot won't bother.
Popular in pro-play to where they were gutted elsewhere, so of course NO SKINS FOR THEM {{sticker:zombie-nunu-tears}}
I'm hoping both Zilean and Xerath get project skins this year. While thematically they may not be the best candidates, visually I think they would be amazing .
They won't. Program maybe, but not PROJECT. PROJECT is for non-magic humans only if I'm not mistaken.
Ahhh I'm the worst about mixing the two, I saw Project on the list of repeated skin lines coming this year and Program just totally slipped my mind
